The Dividing Cell As soon as you look away it happens, The cell\u2019s division, The many unseen movements which conspire With the divine music o f the spheres, To take us further. An orchestra insid^ our bodies Plays relentlesslv O m'\\V\" The music drives us mad, into confusion, Back to the/baby, Who dribbles on his name, Who n^ver guesses, He must face the music once again. Glad Day Take a boy. Make a man. He stands. See mother. The wilderness hasn\u2019t harmed me. Though I spent forty days And forty nights In that place. 20 -e- \n￼Randall 9-36 19/3/93 11:06 pm Page 2 I\u2019ve brought you samples Chipped from those rocks. Take. Eat. This is my body. This is my blood. And still you tell me father It isn\u2019t enough. The next time you both come looking for me, I shall deny you. Mont Blanc Standing at your shin Looking up. The giant-killer boy Knew this thrill. A moment slung between surrender And his own power. * 21 e \n￼Randall 9-36 19/3/93 11:06 pm Page 22, And I made up my mind that this would never do.So after think  ing a little more about it, I resolved that at any rate I would act as if the Bible were true:that if it were not, at all events I should be no worse off than I was before. Sunday\u2019s Child They slaughtered me with the Sabbath. It was no bloody thing But a slow reckoning, Repeated week by week. I was made to contort my limbs Into that day. They pushed my head Between my knees Until I(fainted.^________£<£vn\\~a-<\\ The Earth in Fruit (for Elizabeth Siddal) (,<\\S Lamb with the burnished cords Whose feminine imperative inspired The eyes to smoke and oil to impersonate Your beauty. Nature put the earth in fruit, Nature put your beauty there. And you think beauty can save you. I\u2019ve seen your masters rub it out. Art has you by the milky throat And you have art enough to dote on death As sacrifice.
